unit.name: 6 Armored Division HQ
unit.History: Nicknamed "Supersixth", the Division was formed in Ft.Knox, KY, in 1942. After training in California the 6th was shipped to England for further training. It landed on Utah Beach on July 18, 1944. On August 1, it was placed under command of the just activated Third Army. It fought in Brittany in August and September, before moving East. From late September until late December the Division was in action in Lorraine and on the Saar. It was taken out of the line and into the Metz area between December 21 and December 26. It then started its march north, almost at full strength. The Division assembled on December 29 and 30 under command of III Corps, ready to attack the Germans in the Bastogne area.

commander.Name: Robert W. Grow
commander.PersBio: Grow was born in 1895. In 1940-41, then a lieutenant-colonel, he served as G-3 at the staff of 2nd Armored Division, commanded by General Patton, in Fort Benning, GA. In 1941 he became commander of the 34th Armored Regiment, and later commander of CCB, 8th Armored Division and CCA, 19th Armored Division. He became commander of the 6th Armored Division in 1943. His leadership of the division was described as "splendid" by the men who served under him.
commander.Title: CO
